label: A3BC2D9_mP60_13_ef2g_ab_2g_ef8g-001
title: Monoclinic (II) Ba$_{3}$CoIr$_{2}$O$_{9}$ Structure
comments:
Ba$_{3}$CoIr$_{2}$O$_{9}$ has been observed in three phases (Garg, 2020): \begin{itemize} \item Above 107K it is in the \href{current_web_home_dir/A3BC2D9_hP30_194_bf_a_f_hk-001}{hexagonal Ba$_{3}$CoIr$_{2}$O$_{9}$ structure}, an ordered quaternary form of the \href{current_web_home_dir/AB3C_hP30_194_bf_hk_af-001}{hexagonal BaTiO$_{3}$ structure}. \item Below 107K it transforms into the \href{current_web_home_dir/A3BC2D9_mC60_15_ef_a_f_e4f-001}{monoclinic (I) Ba$_{3}$CoIr$_{2}$O$_{9}$ structure}. \item ``On further reduction of temperature,'' apparently at some point above 60K, the primitive cell doubles and this \href{current_web_home_dir/A3BC2D9_mP60_13_ef2g_ab_2g_ef8g-001}{monoclinic (II) Ba$_{3}$CoIr$_{2}$O$_{9}$ structure} appears.  The monoclinic (I) and monoclinic (II) structures coexist down to absolute zero. \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-.25in} 
 Data for this structure was taken at 60K.
